statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -7 \\ 9 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 17 \\ 8 \\ 18 \\ 0 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 6 \\ -7 \\ 9 \\ 8 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 17 \\ 8 \\ 18 \\ 0 \end{array}\right].
